attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
British soldiers at a military base in Iraq have a major concern about leaving the country at the end of the month - the fate of their camp mascot.

The soldiers are worried he will be put down by local Iraqis or killed by other dogs when they return home to Britain.

Sandbag protects the men of B Squadron of the Queen's Royal Hussars from stray dogs around their base at the southern port of Umm Qasr.

A soldier said: "He's very loyal to the troops - if you get mobbed by other dogs, he will literally fight every single one of them. He's a Tyson among the pups."

The soldiers want to bring him back to Britain but discovered it would cost several thousand pounds to put him in quarantine.

See full story here: http://snipurl.com/fanwd


Please, Prime Minister, waive the quarantine fee, or put up the money, to bring this loyal dog who has been such a comfort to our brave troops, home to Britain.  

It's the very least we can do to thank them.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
